text:
زیست سے تنگ ہو اے داغؔ تو جیتے کیوں ہو
جان پیاری بھی نہیں جان سے جاتے بھی نہیں
داغؔ دہلوی
author: Daagh Dehlvi
explanation: This couplet reflects on the paradox of existence. It can be translated as: "O Daagh, if you're tired of life, why do you continue living? Life isn't dear to you, yet you don't depart from it either." The poet questions the human tendency to cling to life even when it becomes burdensome, highlighting the complex relationship between suffering and the will to live.

text:
ہم کو ان سے وفا کی ہے امید
جو نہیں جانتے وفا کیا ہے
مرزا غالب
author: Mirza Ghalib
explanation: This couplet can be translated as: "We hope for loyalty from those Who don't even know what loyalty is." Ghalib is expressing the irony and perhaps futility of expecting faithfulness or loyalty from someone who doesn't understand or value these concepts. It's a commentary on misplaced expectations in relationships and the pain that can result from them.
